comments.body: :eyes: we don't have `// +optional` here - doesn't this mean this field is already required with newer kubectl versions? (but I guess not with API clients)
this hasn't changed, so... yes... anything submitting a condition using openapi validation would need to include the field, but they could set it's value to an empty string
Huh, I didn't know this happened.. Will there ever be a world where this is true for even things like CRDs? ðŸ™ƒ

probably not? we don't do it for other API types that include conditions with lastTransitionTime... we leave it up to the setting clients... the certificates API was somewhat unique in its use of conditions, and this is matching the existing timestamp defaulting for lastUpdateTime
